query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 Vero è che ’n su la proda mi trovai 8 de la valle d’abisso dolorosa 9 che ’ntrono accoglie d’infiniti guai.
query.result:
**English:**
7 It is true that I found myself on the edge 8 of the dolorous abyssal valley 9 that encircles countless woes.
**Cornish:**
7 Gwir yw ow fe yn sevel war an fordh 8 A'n dowr dywyll a-ugh, leun a boen, 9 Hag a wraitha poenow heb number.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 Oscura e profonda era e nebulosa 11 tanto che, per ficcar lo viso a fondo, 12 io non vi discernea alcuna cosa.
query.result:
**English:**
10 Dark and deep and cloudy it was, 11 so much so that, peering deep inside, 12 I could not make out anything there.
**Cornish:**
10 Tewl ha dowr o, ha mogh, 11vel orth, na'gas treylyas dhe-ves, 12 ny wodhav vythwel dre.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
13 «Or discendiam qua giù nel cieco mondo», 14 cominciò il poeta tutto smorto. 15 «Io sarò primo, e tu sarai secondo».
query.result:
**English:**
13 "Now let us descend here into the blind world," 14 began the poet, all pale. 15 "I will go first, and you shall be second."
**Cornish:**
13 "Wrug a-dro dhe-ves yn-mes an bys dall," 14 a leveris an bardh, oll golan. 15 "Vy a-dhia kyns, ha thow a-vydh nessa."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 E io, che del color mi fui accorto, 17 dissi: «Come verrò, se tu paventi 18 che suoli al mio dubbiare esser conforto?».
query.result:
**English:**
16 And I, who noticed my color, 17 said: "How shall I come, if you are afraid, 18 you who are accustomed to be my comfort in doubt?"
**Cornish:**
16 Ha my, ow tosav vy dha liw, 17 a leveris: "Pynag vythav, mar tos avow, 18 ty a-vydh dhe-ves dhe'm dowtans gwellhes?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 Ed elli a me: «L’angoscia de le genti 20 che son qua giù, nel viso mi dipigne 21 quella pietà che tu per tema senti.
query.result:
**English:**
19 And he to me: "The anguish of the people 20 who are down here paints on my face 21 that pity which you feel as fear.
**Cornish:**
19 Ha henna dhe'm: "An angos a'n dus 20 a-yma yn-mes, yn vy enep a-bros 21 an kethowder a-dheuth ty a-dhew avel dowt."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 Andiam, ché la via lunga ne sospigne». 23 Così si mise e così mi fé intrare 24 nel primo cerchio che l’abisso cigne.
query.result:
**English:**
22 Let us go, for the long road urges us on." 23 Thus he set out and thus he made me enter 24 the first circle that the abyss encircles.
**Cornish:**
22 Dowgh a-dro, rag an fordh hir a-gas dhe-ves." 23 Velhe a-wrug ha velhe a-wrug vy dhe-ves 24 yn kynsa kelgh a-g囲m an dibyn.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 Lo buon maestro a me: «Tu non dimandi 32 che spiriti son questi che tu vedi? 33 Or vo’ che sappi, innanzi che più andi,
34 ch’ei non peccaro; e s’elli hanno mercedi, 35 non basta, perché non ebber battesmo, 36 ch’è porta de la fede che tu credi;
37 e s’e’ furon dinanzi al cristianesmo, 38 non adorar debitamente a Dio: 39 e di questi cotai son io medesmo.
query.result:
**English:**
31 The good master said to me: "Do you not ask 32 what spirits these are that you see? 33 Now I want you to know, before you go any further,
34 that they did not sin; and if they have merit, 35 it is not enough, because they did not receive baptism, 36 which is the gate of the faith that you believe in;
37 and if they were before Christianity, 38 they did not worship God properly: 39 and of such am I myself.
**Cornish:**
31 An mester da dhe'm: "Ty ny dhyskas 32 py spyrys yw an re ma ty a-wel? 33 Mes a-vynn dyskys, kyns my a-dhyskons pella,
34 na'gas pechasons; ha mar yw mergh dhe'n, 35 nyns yw dheugh, rag na'gas kodhans bastem, 36 a-yma porth a'n feyth a-gres ty;
37 ha mar yns ens kyns Kristonyans, 38 nyns esa dhe'n gwellhes dhe Dhew: 39 ha a-dhiwedh an re-ma, henna yw vy."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
40 Per tai difetti, non per altro rio, 41 semo perduti, e sol di tanto offesi 42 che sanza speme vivemo in disio».
query.result:
**English:**
40 For those defects, not for any other harm, 41 we are lost, and only so much offended 42 that without hope we live in desire.
**Cornish:**
40 Rag an feilerow ma, rag drok aral, 41 nyns yw kollet, ha mes rag kemmys yw cammes 42 heb spyrans byw yn an gowes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
43 Gran duol mi prese al cor quando lo ’ntesi, 44 però che gente di molto valore 45 conobbi che ’n quel limbo eran sospesi.
query.result:
**English:**
43 Great sorrow seized my heart when I heard it, 44 because people of great worth 45 I knew were suspended in that limbo.
**Cornish:**
43 Koweth bras a gafasow colon pan vynnav, 44 rag tus a dus a werth bras 45 a wodhavow yn an limb ma o sysi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 «Dimmi, maestro mio, dimmi, segnore», 47 comincia’ io per voler esser certo 48 di quella fede che vince ogne errore:
49 «uscicci mai alcuno, o per suo merto 50 o per altrui, che poi fosse beato?».
query.result:
**English:**
46 "Tell me, my master, tell me, lord," 47 I began, wanting to be certain 48 of that faith that conquers every error:
49 "did anyone ever leave here, either through their own merit 50 or through someone else's, who was then blessed?"
**Cornish:**
46 "Dywedh vy, fy mestyres, dywedh vy, fy argluydh," 47 a dhallathas vy ow tos ha bos sur 48 a'n fydh na a wra dalleth pub kamm:
49 "a dheuth neb erbynn ma, po dhe'y vonys po dhe'y vones aral, 50 hag a veu bennak gwynvydh?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
51 E quei che ’ntese il mio parlar coverto,
52 rispuose: «Io era nuovo in questo stato, 53 quando ci vidi venire un possente, 54 con segno di vittoria coronato.
query.result:
**English:**
51 And he who understood my veiled speech,
52 replied: "I was new in this state, 53 when I saw a mighty one come here, 54 crowned with a sign of victory.
**Cornish:**
51 Ha'n hanow a glewasow colon lavar kudh,
52 a leveris: "Nowydh oen yn an stat ma, 53 pan welyv unn galosek dhe vos dos, 54 korunos gans merk a vykteri.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
55 Trasseci l’ombra del primo parente, 56 d’Abèl suo figlio e quella di Noè, 57 di Moïsè legista e ubidente;
58 Abraàm patrïarca e Davìd re, 59 Israèl con lo padre e co’ suoi nati 60 e con Rachele, per cui tanto fé,
61 e altri molti, e feceli beati.
query.result:
**English:**
55 He drew forth the shade of our first parent, 56 of his son Abel and of Noah, 57 of Moses the lawgiver and obedient;
58 Abraham the patriarch and King David, 59 Israel with his father and his children 60 and with Rachel, for whom he did so much,
61 and many others, and made them blessed.
**Cornish:**
55 Ev a dhallathas skevens an kynsa tas, 56 Abell y vab ha Noa, 57 Moyses an laha ha'n den fur,
58 Abraham an tas ha'n myghtern David, 59 Israel gans y das ha'y vabow 60 ha gans Rachel, rag an neb a wrug kemmys,
61 ha lies a dus, ha'n gwrug ev bennak gwynvydh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
62 E vo’ che sappi che, dinanzi ad essi, 63 spiriti umani non eran salvati».
64 Non lasciavam l’andar perch’ ei dicessi, 65 ma passavam la selva tuttavia, 66 la selva, dico, di spiriti spessi.
query.result:
**English:**
62 And know that, before them, 63 no human spirits were saved."
64 We did not stop walking because he said this, 65 but we continued through the forest, 66 the forest, I say, of thick spirits.
**Cornish:**
62 Ha'th whyllow bos sur, kyns anedha, 63 spyrys a dus na veu gwynvys.
64 Nyns a lettymbas an kerdhes rag an neb a leveris, 65 mes nyns a drehedhas an wals ma, 66 an wals, lavarav, a spyrys tewl.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
67 Non era lunga ancor la nostra via 68 di qua dal sonno, quand’ io vidi un foco 69 ch’emisperio di tenebre vincia.
query.result:
**English:**
67 Our way was not long yet 68 from this side of sleep, when I saw a fire 69 that conquered a hemisphere of darkness.
**Cornish:**
67 Nyns o hir an fordh nyns 68 ow bysma an kows, pan welyv unn tan 69 a wra dalleth hanter an tywyllyow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
70 Di lungi n’eravamo ancora un poco, 71 ma non sì ch’io non discernessi in parte 72 ch’orrevol gente possedea quel loco.
query.result:
**English:**
70 We were still a little way off, 71 but not so far that I could not make out in part 72 that a rebellious people possessed that place.**Cornish:**
70 Pelledh o honan niver un byghan, 71 mes na gensi pelledh na’m gwelasen yn rann 72 bos an dus tus o ostyas an le.**

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
73 «O tu ch’onori scïenzïa e arte, 74 questi chi son c’hanno cotanta onranza, 75 che dal modo de li altri li diparte?».
query.result:
**English:**
73 "O you who honor science and art, 74 who are these who have such great honor, 75 that sets them apart from the others?"**Cornish:**
73 "O ty owth onorya skians ha arta, 74 pyw yw an re ma a wra an keth onour, 75 ow syw owth rann a'n dus re erel?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
76 E quelli a me: «L’onrata nominanza 77 che di lor suona sù ne la tua vita, 78 grazïa acquista in ciel che sì li avanza».
query.result:
**English:**
76 And those to me: "The honored fame 77 that resounds of them up in your life, 78 acquires grace in heaven that so advances them."
**Cornish:**
76 Ha'gasowdhyn: "An enor bras 77 a sowna orth y'gan jynn orth dha vewnans, 78 a gwaynya gras yn nef a'gas avansia."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
79 Intanto voce fu per me udita: 80 «Onorate l’altissimo poeta; 81 l’ombra sua torna, ch’era dipartita».
query.result:
**English:**
79 Meanwhile a voice was heard by me: 80 "Honor the most high poet; 81 his shade returns, which had departed."
**Cornish:**
79 Yn keffrys, kov a veu klevys gansan: 80 "Enorya an bardh moyha," 81 "y golon a dhehweles, a veu a-dyskerrans."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
82 Poi che la voce fu restata e queta, 83 vidi quattro grand’ ombre a noi venire: 84 sembianz’ avevan né trista né lieta.
query.result:
**English:**
82 After the voice had ceased and was quiet, 83 I saw four great shades come towards us: 84 they had neither sad nor joyful countenances.
**Cornish:**
82 Wosa veu an kov gorfenna ha tas, 83 me a welas peswar golon bras ow tos orthyn: 84 nag oen aga semlans trist nag lowen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
85 Lo buon maestro cominciò a dire: 86 «Mira colui con quella spada in mano, 87 che vien dinanzi ai tre sì come sire:
88 quelli è Omero poeta sovrano; 89 l’altro è Orazio satiro che vene; 90 Ovidio è ’l terzo, e l’ultimo Lucano.
query.result:
**English:**
85 The good master began to say: 86 "Look at the one with that sword in his hand, 87 who comes before the three like a lord:
88 he is Homer, the sovereign poet; 89 the other is Horace, the satirist, who comes; 90 Ovid is the third, and the last is Lucan.
**Cornish:**
85 An mester da bys dalleth leverel: 86 "Sel an onan gans an cledha na y'dha llaw, 87 ow tos kyns an tri avel orth arluydh:
88 henna yw Homer, an bardh moyha; 89 an nessa yw Horatius, an satyrydh, ow tos; 90 Ovid yw an tres, ha Lucan yw an diwettha."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
91 Però che ciascun meco si convene 92 nel nome che sonò la voce sola, 93 fannomi onore, e di ciò fanno bene».
query.result:
**English:**
91 Because each one agrees with me 92 in the name that the solitary voice sounded, 93 they do me honor, and they do well in that.
**Cornish:**
91 Rag tas pub onan a omdhyskyn gansan 92 yn hanow henna a sonas an kov onan, 93 ymons onor, ha ymons da ynwedh henna."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
94 Così vid’ i’ adunar la bella scola 95 di quel segnor de l’altissimo canto 96 che sovra li altri com’ aquila vola.
query.result:
**English:**
94 Thus I saw the beautiful school gather 95 of that lord of the most high song 96 who flies above the others like an eagle.
**Cornish:**
94 Henna yw an fordh a welas ow kesunya 95 a'gan Arluydh a'n gana moyha 96 ow hedha a-ugh an erel erel oll.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
103 Così andammo infino a la lumera, 104 parlando cose che ’l tacere è bello, 105 sì com’ era ’l parlar colà dov’ era.
query.result:
**English:**
103 Thus we went until we reached the light, 104 speaking of things that it is beautiful to keep silent about, 105 just as it was beautiful to speak there where we were.
**Cornish:**
103 Henna yw an fordh a gerdhas bys yn-bes an golonter, 104 ow leverel a-dro dhewedhow a wra dhelergh, 105 kepar ha'n wra leverel ena yn le mayth oen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
106 Venimmo al piè d’un nobile castello, 107 sette volte cerchiato d’alte mura, 108 difeso intorno d’un bel fiumicello.
query.result:
**English:**
106 We came to the foot of a noble castle, 107 encircled seven times by high walls, 108 defended all around by a beautiful little river.
**Cornish:**
106 Ni a dheuth dhe'n tros a'n kastel nobyl, 107 seyth gweyth ow kelghi gans mur a-ugh, 108 ow difres a-dro gans avonig brav.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
109 Questo passammo come terra dura; 110 per sette porte intrai con questi savi: 111 giugnemmo in prato di fresca verdura.

Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
112 Genti v’eran con occhi tardi e gravi, 113 di grande autorità ne’ lor sembianti: 114 parlavan rado, con voci soavi.
query.result:
**English:**
112 There were 112 people with slow and serious eyes, 113 of great authority in their appearance: 114 they spoke rarely, with gentle voices.
**Cornish:**
112 Kans 112 oedh gans lagha ha dewdhek ha grow, 113 a vri maur yn aga semlansow: 114 aga kewsel oedh ankow, gans leusow melyon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
115 Traemmoci così da l’un de’ canti, 116 in loco aperto, luminoso e alto, 117 sì che veder si potien tutti quanti.
query.result:
**English:**
115 We thus emerged from one of the banks, 116 into an open, bright and lofty place, 117 so that we could see all of them.
**Cornish:**
115 Nyns ny wodhvynna onan a'gan kledh, 116 yn le may open, golow ha ughel, 117 mar a alla a'gan gweles oll anedha.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
118 Colà diritto, sovra ’l verde smalto, 119 mi fuor mostrati li spiriti magni, 120 che del vedere in me stesso m’essalto.
query.result:
**English:**
118 There, straight ahead, upon the verdant enamel, 119 the great spirits were shown to me, 120 which in seeing them I exalt myself.
**Cornish:**
118 Awn, yn-mes, wartha an glas emell, 119 y feu dyskwedhes an spyrys meur, 120 ow pyth y gweles y’m gorhemmys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
121 I’ vidi Eletra con molti compagni, 122 tra ’ quai conobbi Ettòr ed Enea, 123 Cesare armato con li occhi grifagni.
query.result:
**English:**
121 I saw Electra with many companions, 122 among whom I recognized Hector and Aeneas, 123 Caesar armed with his piercing eyes.
**Cornish:**
121 Yma vi Elektra gans moy a-gevreyth, 122 ynter aga yth esom Hektor hag Aineas, 123 Cesar arvek gans y lyga gref.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
124 Vidi Cammilla e la Pantasilea; 125 da l’altra parte vidi ’l re Latino 126 che con Lavina sua figlia sedea.
query.result:
**English:**
124 I saw Camilla and Penthesilea; 125 on the other side I saw King Latinus 126 who sat with his daughter Lavinia.
**Cornish:**
124 Yma vi Kammilla ha Panthasilea; 125 wartha an tu-a-benn yth esom an myghtern Latinus 126 ow sedea gans y vergh Lavinia.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
127 Vidi quel Bruto che cacciò Tarquino, 128 Lucrezia, Iulia, Marzïa e Corniglia; 129 e solo, in parte, vidi ’l Saladino.
query.result:
**English:**
127 I saw that Brutus who expelled Tarquin, 128 Lucretia, Julia, Marcia, and Cornelia; 129 and alone, in a corner, I saw Saladin.
**Cornish:**
127 Gweles an Brutes na wrug Tarquin, 128 Lucretia, Julia, Marcia ha Corniglia; 129 ha onan, yn rann, gweles an Saladino.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
130 Poi ch’innalzai un poco più le ciglia, 131 vidi ’l maestro di color che sanno 132 seder tra filosofica famiglia.
query.result:
**English:**
130 Then when I raised my eyelashes a little more, 131 I saw the master of those who know 132 sitting among a philosophical family.
**Cornish:**
130 Pan wosa'm uskis onan moy an golgasow, 131 mi a welas an mester a'n re beu gowsow 132 ow sidya ynter filosofek teulu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
145 Io non posso ritrar di tutti a pieno, 146 però che sì mi caccia il lungo tema, 147 che molte volte al fatto il dir vien meno.
query.result:
**English:**
145 I cannot recount all of them fully, 146 because the long subject matter presses me so, 147 that often the words fail to keep up with the facts.
**Cornish:**
145 Nyns yw gallos vy dhe dhiskwedhes oll a-ugh, 146 rag an tema hir a-gas vy dhe dhyskynna, 147 pub moy an lavarow a-dhrehev dhe'n gwir.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
148 La sesta compagnia in due si scema: 149 per altra via mi mena il savio duca, 150 fuor de la queta, ne l’aura che trema.
query.result:
**English:**
148 The sixth company divides itself into two: 149 my wise guide leads me along another path, 150 out of the quiet, into the trembling air.
**Cornish:**
148 An whethves kompani a dheuth yn dew: 149 rag an fordh aral a'm gorra an dhugen golonnek, 150 mes an keth, yn an awel a dhregh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
151 E vegno in parte ove non è che luca.
query.result:
**English:**
151 And I come to a place where there is no light.
**Cornish:**
151 Ha mos dheuth dhe benn nans yw goulou.
